labels.analysis: The Geo News MCP Server specializes in providing localized news content based on geographic data. Its core functionality allows agents to retrieve news tailored to specific countries or locations, enhancing context-aware information retrieval for regional updates. The available tools focus on fetching country-specific news and searching for articles by keywords, indicating a strong emphasis on geospatial news aggregation and filtering.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of the server revolves around news retrieval and localization, which aligns well with the "News & Media" category. The tools available support geographic filtering, making "Web Search & Research" a relevant secondary label due to the search and news aggregation capabilities. The custom label "Geospatial News Aggregation" was chosen to highlight the unique aspect of location-based news filtering not explicitly covered by predefined labels.

tools.name: get_news_by_country
tools.description: Get latest news from a specific country

tools.name: search_news
tools.description: Search for news articles by keyword

server_info_crawled.overview: Provide localized news content dynamically based on geographic data. Enable agents to access and retrieve news resources tailored to specific locations. Enhance context-aware information retrieval for applications requiring up-to-date regional news.

tools.name: get_news_by_country
tools.description: Get latest news from a specific country

tools.name: search_news
tools.description: Search for news articles by keyword

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "newsApiKey": "f6f44383e2f24650acf005a04bba7cf1"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Ymuberra/geo-news-mcp/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
